page.title: 01GENERAL FEATURES
page.content: {CHARACTERISTICS:}rural, mainly poor farmland, moor, and derelict land due to China Clay extraction. {INDUSTRIES:}China Clay mining most important, also farming particularly cattle. Tin mining important in the past but no active mines today. {POPULATION:}low density; live in isolated cottages and in small villages, such as Carthew, Penwithick and Ruddlemoor. Most work in St. Austell; many employed in China Clay. {POLITICS:}the area is mainly Liberal. {CLIMATE:}mild; the weather is variable and notoriously wet. {AMENITIES:}a few public houses, a working men's club at Penwithick, a judo club and the Wheal Martyn China Clay Museum at Carthew. {SHOPS:}a few shops and post offices {RELIGION:}mainly methodist, but also Anglican; Church attendances falling.
